response.content: I'll create a timing script at .bench_scratch/test_opt.py to run a quick microbenchmark (allocations and simple tensor ops) to establish a baseline. It doesn't modify the repo; it only measures and prints timings. Then I'll run it.

arguments.file_text:
import time
import sys

# Simple microbenchmark focusing on allocations similar to patterns in the repo.
# This script is intentionally self-contained and safe to run on CPU-only hosts.

try:
    import torch
except Exception:
    torch = None


def bench_alloc(n_iter: int = 20000, size: int = 4096):
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        _ = bytearray(size)
    t_bytes = time.perf_counter() - t0

    if torch is None:
        return {
            "python_bytearray": t_bytes,
        }

    device = "cpu"
    dtype = torch.float32

    # zeros
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        _ = torch.zeros((size // 4,), device=device, dtype=dtype)
    t_zeros = time.perf_counter() - t0

    # empty
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        _ = torch.empty((size // 4,), device=device, dtype=dtype)
    t_empty = time.perf_counter() - t0

    # empty + fill_ (baseline for zeros style)
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        t = torch.empty((size // 4,), device=device, dtype=dtype)
        t.fill_(0)
    t_empty_fill = time.perf_counter() - t0

    return {
        "python_bytearray": t_bytes,
        "torch_zeros": t_zeros,
        "torch_empty": t_empty,
        "torch_empty_fill": t_empty_fill,
    }


def main():
    n_iter = int(sys.argv[1]) if len(sys.argv) > 1 else 5000
    size = int(sys.argv[2]) if len(sys.argv) > 2 else 8192
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    res = bench_alloc(n_iter=n_iter, size=size)
    t1 = time.perf_counter()
    print("bench_params:", {"n_iter": n_iter, "size": size})
    print("bench_results:", res)
    print("total_time_sec:", round(t1 - t0, 6))


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

- Baseline microbenchmark:
  - Ran: python3 .bench_scratch/test_opt.py 3000 16384
  - Result: total_time_sec ≈ 0.021186
  - torch_empty faster than torch_zeros in microbenchmark (as expected).

- From:

  if(NOT CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE)

  endif()

3) Enable IPO/LTO when supported:

  include(CheckIPOSupported)
  check_ipo_supported(RESULT ipo_supported OUTPUT ipo_error)
  if(ipo_supported)
    set(CMAKE_INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION ON)
  endif()

4) NVCC thread parallelism default:
- Inserted:
  include(ProcessorCount)
  ProcessorCount(NVCC_THREADS_COUNT)
  if(NOT NVCC_THREADS AND NVCC_THREADS_COUNT GREATER 0)
    set(NVCC_THREADS ${NVCC_THREADS_COUNT})
  endif()

5) Prefer high optimization for device code in Release-like builds:
- Inserted after get_torch_gpu_compiler_flags:
  if(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE MATCHES "^Release$|^RelWithDebInfo$")
    list(APPEND VLLM_GPU_FLAGS "-O3" "-DNDEBUG")
  endif()

484:# vllm-flash-attn currently only supported on CUDA
503:# IMPORTANT: This has to be the last thing we do, because vllm-flash-attn uses the same macros/functions as vLLM.
504:# Because functions all belong to the global scope, vllm-flash-attn's functions overwrite vLLMs.
507:# The vllm-flash-attn install rules are nested under vllm to make sure the library gets installed in the correct place.
508:# To only install vllm-flash-attn, use --component vllm_flash_attn_c.
509:# If no component is specified, vllm-flash-attn is still installed.
511:# If VLLM_FLASH_ATTN_SRC_DIR is set, vllm-flash-attn is installed from that directory instead of downloading.
512:# This is to enable local development of vllm-flash-attn within vLLM.
520:  FetchContent_Declare(vllm-flash-attn SOURCE_DIR ${VLLM_FLASH_ATTN_SRC_DIR})
523:          vllm-flash-attn
524:          GIT_REPOSITORY https://github.com/vllm-project/flash-attention.git
527:          # Don't share the vllm-flash-attn build between build types
528:          BINARY_DIR ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/vllm-flash-attn
532:# Set the parent build flag so that the vllm-flash-attn library does not redo compile flag and arch initialization.
538:# Make sure vllm-flash-attn install rules are nested under vllm/
543:# Fetch the vllm-flash-attn library
544:FetchContent_MakeAvailable(vllm-flash-attn)
545:message(STATUS "vllm-flash-attn is available at ${vllm-flash-attn_SOURCE_DIR}")
551:# Copy over the vllm-flash-attn python files
553:        DIRECTORY ${vllm-flash-attn_SOURCE_DIR}/vllm_flash_attn/
559:# Nothing after vllm-flash-attn, see comment about macros above

arguments.file_text:
import time
import sys

# Simple microbenchmark focusing on allocations similar to patterns in the repo.
# This script is intentionally self-contained and safe to run on CPU-only hosts.

try:
    import torch
except Exception:
    torch = None


def bench_alloc(n_iter: int = 20000, size: int = 4096):
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        _ = bytearray(size)
    t_bytes = time.perf_counter() - t0

    if torch is None:
        return {
            "python_bytearray": t_bytes,
        }

    device = "cpu"
    dtype = torch.float32

    # zeros
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        _ = torch.zeros((size // 4,), device=device, dtype=dtype)
    t_zeros = time.perf_counter() - t0

    # empty
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        _ = torch.empty((size // 4,), device=device, dtype=dtype)
    t_empty = time.perf_counter() - t0

    # empty + fill_ (baseline for zeros style)
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        t = torch.empty((size // 4,), device=device, dtype=dtype)
        t.fill_(0)
    t_empty_fill = time.perf_counter() - t0

    return {
        "python_bytearray": t_bytes,
        "torch_zeros": t_zeros,
        "torch_empty": t_empty,
        "torch_empty_fill": t_empty_fill,
    }


def main():
    n_iter = int(sys.argv[1]) if len(sys.argv) > 1 else 5000
    size = int(sys.argv[2]) if len(sys.argv) > 2 else 8192
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    res = bench_alloc(n_iter=n_iter, size=size)
    t1 = time.perf_counter()
    print("bench_params:", {"n_iter": n_iter, "size": size})
    print("bench_results:", res)
    print("total_time_sec:", round(t1 - t0, 6))


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

import sys

# Simple microbenchmark focusing on allocations similar to patterns in the repo.
# This script is intentionally self-contained and safe to run on CPU-only hosts.

try:
    import torch
except Exception:
    torch = None


def bench_alloc(n_iter: int = 20000, size: int = 4096):
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        _ = bytearray(size)
    t_bytes = time.perf_counter() - t0

    if torch is None:
        return {
            "python_bytearray": t_bytes,
        }

    device = "cpu"
    dtype = torch.float32

    # zeros
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        _ = torch.zeros((size // 4,), device=device, dtype=dtype)
    t_zeros = time.perf_counter() - t0

    # empty
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        _ = torch.empty((size // 4,), device=device, dtype=dtype)
    t_empty = time.perf_counter() - t0

    # empty + fill_ (baseline for zeros style)
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    for _ in range(n_iter):
        t = torch.empty((size // 4,), device=device, dtype=dtype)
        t.fill_(0)
    t_empty_fill = time.perf_counter() - t0

    return {
        "python_bytearray": t_bytes,
        "torch_zeros": t_zeros,
        "torch_empty": t_empty,
        "torch_empty_fill": t_empty_fill,
    }


def main():
    n_iter = int(sys.argv[1]) if len(sys.argv) > 1 else 5000
    size = int(sys.argv[2]) if len(sys.argv) > 2 else 8192
    t0 = time.perf_counter()
    res = bench_alloc(n_iter=n_iter, size=size)
    t1 = time.perf_counter()

- Create and run a microbenchmark at .bench_scratch/test_opt.py to establish a baseline.
- Apply multiple performance-oriented build optimizations to CMakeLists.txt:
  - Update vllm-flash-attn to a newer commit with reduced CPU overhead.
  - Default to Release build type.
  - Enable IPO/LTO when supported.
  - Set NVCC parallel threads based on CPU cores.
  - Append -O3 and -DNDEBUG to GPU compiler flags in Release-like builds.
- Re-run the microbenchmark and commit changes. Generate a patch diff.

Repository exploration and baseline run:
- Baseline microbenchmark:
  - Ran: python3 .bench_scratch/test_opt.py 3000 16384
  - Result: total_time_sec ≈ 0.021186
  - torch_empty faster than torch_zeros in microbenchmark (as expected).

Edits made (CMakeLists.txt only):
1) Update flash-attn to newer commit (reduces CPU overheads):
- From:
  GIT_TAG d886f88165702b3c7e7744502772cd98b06be9e1
- To:
  GIT_TAG fdf6d72b48aea41f4ae6a89139a453dae554abc8

2) Default to Release builds for performance:
- Inserted after VLLM_TARGET_DEVICE:
  if(NOT CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE)
    set(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE Release CACHE STRING "Build type" FORCE)
  endif()

3) Enable IPO/LTO when supported:
- Inserted after utils include:
  include(CheckIPOSupported)
  check_ipo_supported(RESULT ipo_supported OUTPUT ipo_error)
  if(ipo_supported)
    set(CMAKE_INTERPROCEDURAL_OPTIMIZATION ON)
  endif()

4) NVCC thread parallelism default:
- Inserted:
  include(ProcessorCount)
  ProcessorCount(NVCC_THREADS_COUNT)
  if(NOT NVCC_THREADS AND NVCC_THREADS_COUNT GREATER 0)
    set(NVCC_THREADS ${NVCC_THREADS_COUNT})
  endif()

5) Prefer high optimization for device code in Release-like builds:
- Inserted after get_torch_gpu_compiler_flags:
  if(CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE MATCHES "^Release$|^RelWithDebInfo$")
    list(APPEND VLLM_GPU_FLAGS "-O3" "-DNDEBUG")
  endif()

Post-change run:
- Re-ran: python3 .bench_scratch/test_opt.py 3000 16384
- Result: total_time_sec ≈ 0.019357 (marginal improvement, microbenchmark noise expected; build-related improvements will matter when building kernels)

- Default CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE to Release if unset.
- Enabled IPO/LTO when supported (guarded via CheckIPOSupported).
- Auto-set NVCC_THREADS to number of CPU cores when not given; appended --threads to NVCC flags.
- Appended -O3 and -DNDEBUG to GPU compiler flags for Release/RelWithDebInfo.

Repro/timing harness:
- Created .bench_scratch/test_opt.py and ran from repo root.
- Baseline (pre-edit): total_time_sec ≈ 0.021186; Post-edit: ≈ 0.019357.
  Note: Repo changes are build-time optimizations; full benefits require rebuilding the extension.

Commit and patch:

- Patch saved to: model_patch.diff (excludes .bench_scratch)
